page.title: 15WOODS AROUND AYMESTREY-FAUNA
page.content: {BIRDS}found in the area are;- woodpecker, kestrel, buzzard, jay, sparrowhawk, pheasant, partridge, magpie, nuthatch, and tree creeper. Fieldfare, redwing and blackbird feed in the pastures and roost in the forest at night. The smaller birds include;-great tits, blue, coal, marsh,willow and long tailed tits. Chaffinch, greenfinch,goldfinch, and bullfinch in larch areas and red flycatchers in oak belts.Along the river are;-moorhen, coot, dipper,heron and kingfisher. {MAMMALS}Grey squirrels and rabbits are in large numbers and are controlled as pests. Small rodents are;- bank vole, wood mouse, harvest mouse, and common shrew. There are hedgehogs in large numbers as well as fox, badger and the rare feral cat. Fallow deer are also seen.
